I am currently pursuing my M.Sc. degree in Computer Science and Engineering at Sabanci University and serve as a Teaching Assistant at Computer and Network Security (CS 432/532) course. In my thesis, I implement a data-driven intrusion detection for 6LoWPAN based IoT systems under the supervision of Prof. Albert Levi.
I have also been working as a Research Intern at Purdue University under the supervision of Dr. Z. Berkay Celik. The aim of the internship is to develop security solutions for IoT systems and, we implement a secure and robust context-based sensor pairing scheme in the smart home context.
Soon, I will start a new chapter of my life for taking a big step towards my lifelong goal, which is becoming a faculty member.
My research interests include IoT/CPS security and privacy, wireless network security, systems security, software security and the privacy of machine learning systems.
